I don't see what OP being bronze has to do with anything. I'm bronze, and I see Lee Sin as one of the funniest things to see on the enemy. Really. Lee Sin has one of the highest skill floors in the game, and its hilarious. I know for sure I can't play him, so I play different champs. And when Lee Sin invades my jungle at level 7 against me as Nunu, and steals blue, and still thinks he can get out, I find it funny. So he ward jumps the blu buff wall. I got flash. So he flashes over the inner wall of the river. I got him slowed with my second q and a speed boost, and he is at 1/3 health. I get one more q on him, and he will be critically low. Easy peasy to kill him usually. Happened at least 5 times in memory.

I don't mean to berate but it's just a funny observation that it's mostly very low elos complaining about a champion with a really high skill cap that is very underwhelming when not played up to a standard. 

It is all relative to the skill of other people in the game but still.... Do people realize how much something extremely straight-forward like a Xin Zhao can sky-rocket you out of bronze/silver if you have a half patched up understanding of the jungle and the game in general?

Anyone who would beat you so hard in low elo so as to make you come on the forums and cry about it is generally not somebody who deserves to be in the elo he's in and is going to rise out eventually.

I like your attitude though, you seem like a player who will learn fast and rank up. :)

Well thanks, I like to think so too. Though being I no longer play Solo Queue, it will be hard, unless I find a good team who thinks like me. 

On another note, I do see people with Gold borders in about 1/3 of my normal queue games now, and very often see Silver borders, so I know I probably should say I am Bronze anymore. 

And on a third note, I have decided I don't care too much about my ELO rating, because I can see that as I get into higher skill tiers, I will have fewer "Good" games, as the champions with a high skill floor will become more viable, and bring more snowballing potential and late game outscaling potential. I value the good games, and while I can have fun playing AP Nasus top, pushing lanes all day and generally making it impossible for the enemy to group in a team fight, I don't do so often because it feels too onesided. I don't feel rewarded for my skill, but rather for my build. Which should never be the sole reason you can win, especially on such a gimmicky build. However, there is good news for that build, as Luden's Echo essentially adds 15% more AP Ratio to that E we all know and love. It does more for other champs, but hey! when the item fits, use it.

When they aren't new to Lee, they basically take over both jungles and starve the enemy jungler, and there's nothing you can do about it because Lee scales better early game than everyone else, and he's impossible to catch on the rare occasion you actually start winning a fight.

http://www.lolking.net/summoner/euw/19690690#matches/2010615602 the 10 2 11 nautilus game. Toggle details. 

I went from kruggs to red and he did gromp and invaded and killed me at red at lvl 2. I curb stomped the game back in his face by playing well, predicting his movements and pulling a few successful counter-ganks back to back. After that he was useless.
I'd put more examples but as I may have mentioned Lee is kinda rare atm.

And do note the guy is a Master 1 lee sin main with a 22/7 W/L record on him this season against other high diamonds+.

And no he wasn't "messing around in normals." Even if he was playing it on 20% of his capability he would still beat the bloody hell out of most of the player base.

Nerfing Lee is challenging.  It's not a matter of simply adjusting numbers -- they've done that a dozen times and it never sticks.

What he needs is real weaknesses.  Right now the only one you can really point at is "it's easy to fail on this guy".  He needs to have downsides that good players actually care about.  

Maybe "isn't very good at killing jungle monsters", "is pretty squishy when you catch him", or "has a hard time initiating teamfights" -- these aren't actually true about him today, but if you picked one or two and made it true about him tomorrow, possibly he wouldn't be this obnoxiously good at everything guy that works in every rendition of the jungle ever.

Even tho they said Lee is a problem, I really don't feel all that threatened when up against a Lee compared to other junglers like Vi , J4, Rek, Nid, or even Amumu or Fid. 

He requires good mechanics and decision making to do well, which....unfortunately not a lot of people posses the skills to play him well.

If he can land a skill shot with barely any cd and let's face it, no cost, he can get scary. His r deals far too much damage imo for a bruiser, it out scales some mages ults with one item he can do 700+ in an aoe while being as tanky and evasive.

That's because he wasn't supposed to be a bruiser, he was an assassin. They just screwed up his numbers in a way that forces the "erm mer gersh mer ferce is meltin'!" early damage but falls off tremendously late game if not ahead by a ton. if they rebalanced him into a proper, squishy assassin that had to worry about blowing up in a fight (but also didn't just fall off damage-wise), that would address a lot of his problems because you would have a chance to kill the b**tard.

Yup,  he's an assassin with fighter stats. Meaning he can burst hard early without being punished for his mistakes. As all his cool downs are low. Besides, Late game he builds like a fighter and his insane utility carry him beyond his damage numbers. On other words,  he has no weak point in the game.

Lee Sin has the highest ability damage and scaling of any mainstream jungler with his Q E R Q combo, dealing over 1,100 base damage with 480% bonus AD scaling on it plus an 8% missing health execute.

Anyone who thinks Lee "scales badly" is delusional: what's happening is that his base numbers are so high that he can afford to just build a Warrior Enchant and then go full tank while still being having kill potential on anyone that doesn't build tanky. Offensive Lee Sun may die easily in team fights, but that applies equally to all melee bruisers. It doesn't change the fact that his ratios are ridiculously high.

Regarding counterjungling, Lee Sin's kit will demolish virtually anyone else 1v1. While some champs like J4 or Vi need to use their mobility abilities to deal damage and win a 1v1 and can thus be caught easily by lane mates if they commit to fight your jungler, Lee Sin can unleash his full offensive combo and still ward-hop over a wall if things turn south. The degree of risk that Lee Sin is exposed to while counterjungling is far too low considering that a lot of potential junglers are getting their ass kicked in the first 2 clears.

But really, none of this should be news: every jungler who played during season 4 should know this. The S4 jungle meta amounted to "play Lee Sin and people that Lee Sin doesn't shit on", like Elise or Kha'Zix. Anyone else was just meat thrown to the grinder.

Its been true for a long time yes, play lee or someone he cant instagib in order to survive the swarm of lee wins. He's got a low ban rate because his skill set is intimidating to noobs in the lower ranks but in the hands of the barely competent, he becomes a force to be reckoned with.

They said they intended to hit him this/the next PBE patch, once they have better changes set up that don't outright destroy him but still make him not be so oppressive. You do realize they can only fit in so much stuff each patch or else the patches take a lot longer to put out (because bug fixing requires more time for more stuff needing bugs fixed, obviously). They knocked down J4 last patch, knocked down Nidalee this patch, addressed *some* issues with Vi's early game power, and clearly have their sights set on Lee as the next of the god tier junglers they want to finally topple.

Given the back lash (we all know it'll come). Lee will probably be the sole inhabitant of that patch.

I pretty much have.  The community was the main issue that never got improved, but once I realized that Riot is running this train full speed in the wrong direction with no regard for what the non-pro players think, I lost hope. I still have friends that play, and they are good people so I will still hop on from time to time just to hang out with them, but I will do so knowing this game will be more and more about mobility, more about having a support role that people don't want to play but Riot feels it needs to be reinforced outside the meta, and more about having a small handful of viable junglers.  The core game is still great, and Riot still does a great multitude of things very well with this, but at this point I just don't see this progressing toward being a better game anymore.  It's also quite refreshing to play a different game where the general focus of players is to *play the game* instead of complain, blame, and insult each other.
